channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Airlines Cancel Hundreds of Flights In Anticipation of Powerful Winter Storm
item.description: Airlines are canceling hundreds of flights over the weekend in anticipation of frigid weather and ice and now across much of the country.

item.title: A Canadian Olympic snowboarder turned alleged drug kingpin is arrested in Mexico
item.description: Ryan Wedding was among the FBI's top fugitives and faces charges related to drug trafficking and the killing of a federal witness. He reportedly turne...

item.title: Gladys West, mathematician whose work paved the way for GPS, dies at 95

item.title: Hundreds of Minnesota Businesses on Strike in Protest Against ICE
item.description: Thousands of protesters shut down streets throughout Minneapolis-St. Paul to demand that federal immigration agents end their weekslong crackdown. Bus...

item.title: Trump expands policy banning aid to groups abroad that discuss or provide abortions

item.title: At Davos, U.S. allies question a fraying world order
item.description: It was a volatile week for trans-Atlantic relations, marked by President Trump statements that unsettled global markets and strained ties with U.S. al...

item.title: Trump Wants to Build More U.S. Military Bases in Greenland. How Many Are There Now?
item.description: The U.S. once maintained more than a dozen. Now it has one. President Trump wants more.

item.title: Colorado Authorities Confirm Suicide by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: After a monthslong review, investigators have concluded that “all speculative theories could not be substantiated.”

item.title: 'Get warm, get safe and stay there,' officials warn as massive storm bears down on U.S.
item.description: Forecasters say the storm will dump heavy snow, sleet and freezing rain from the Southern Rockies into New England through Monday.

item.title: At March for Life, Some Abortion Opponents Want More From Trump
item.description: At the March for Life, Vice President JD Vance acknowledged “a fear that some of you have that not enough progress has been made.”
